title: Firefox 33.0 Release

notes.note:
[OpenH264 support][1] (sandboxed)


  [1]: http://andreasgal.com/2014/10/14/openh264-now-in-firefox/

[Improved search experience][1] through the location bar


  [1]: http://msujaws.wordpress.com/2014/08/01/faster-and-snappier-searches-now-in-firefox-aurora/

Windows: [OMTC][1] enabled by default


  [1]: https://wiki.mozilla.org/Platform/GFX/OffMainThreadCompositing

Slimmer and faster [JavaScript strings][1]

  [1]: https://blog.mozilla.org/javascript/2014/07/21/slimmer-and-faster-javascript-strings-in-firefox/
Search suggestions on the Firefox Start (about:home) and new tab (about:newtab) pages
Support for connecting to HTTP proxy over HTTPS
New CSP (Content Security Policy) backend

Improved reliability of the [session restoration][1]

  [1]: https://dutherenverseauborddelatable.wordpress.com/2014/06/26/firefox-the-browser-that-has-your-backup/
Azerbaijani [az] locale added

[JSD (JavaScript Debugger Service) removed][1] in favor of the Debugger interface


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Debugger-API
Proprietary window.crypto properties/functions removed

[DOMMatrix][1] interface implemented


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DOMMatrix

[@counter-style rule][1] from CSS3 Counter Styles specification implemented


  [1]: http://dev.w3.org/csswg/css-counter-styles/#the-counter-style-rule

[Cubic-bezier curves][1] editor


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Page_Inspector#Editing_cubic_B.C3.A9zier_curves

[Paint flashing][1] for browser content repaints


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Paint_Flashing_Tool

Display which elements have [listeners attached][1]


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Page_Inspector#Examining_event_listeners

[New sidebar][1] which displays a list of shortcuts to every @media rule in the current stylesheet


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Style_Editor#The_media_sidebar

[Editable @keyframes][1] rules in the Rules section of the Inspector


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Page_Inspector#Editing_keyframes

[CSS transform highlighter][1] in the style-inspector


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Page_Inspector#transform_visualisation
Various security fixes

Fix incomplete downloads being marked as complete by detecting broken HTTP1.1 transfers ([237623][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=237623
PDF.js: With some images, wrong colors could show up. Affects a very small number of PDF

Some certificate errors cannot be overridden ([1042889][1])


  [1]: http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/1042889

Windows: On some combination of hardware and drivers, the main window could be black. In this case, update your graphics drivers ([1083071][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1083071

Windows: With Avast HTTPS scanning enabled, Firefox will not close correctly ([1087674][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1087674

Windows: Interface may be slow when typing or selecting text ([1089183][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1089183

text: We'd also like to extend a special thank you to all of the new Mozillians who contributed to this release of Firefox!
system_requirements:
## Windows

### Operating Systems
 - Windows XP SP2
 - Windows Server 2003 SP1
 - Windows Vista
 - Windows 7
 - Windows 8

*Please note that while the 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Windows Vista and Windows 7 can be used to run Firefox 33, only 32-bit builds of Firefox 33 are supported at this time.*

### Recommended Hardware
-  Pentium 4 or newer processor that supports SSE2
-  512MB of RAM
-  200MB of hard drive space

---

## Mac

### Operating Systems
- Mac OS X 10.6
- Mac OS X 10.7
- Mac OS X 10.8
- Mac OS X 10.9

### Recommended Hardware
- Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 processor
- 512 MB of RAM
- 200 MB hard drive space

---

## GNU/Linux

### Software Requirements

*Please note that GNU/Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*

- Firefox will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    - GTK+ 2.18 or higher
    - GLib 2.22 or higher
    - Pango 1.14 or higher
    - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
    - libstdc++ 4.3 or higher
- For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    - DBus 1.0 or higher
    - HAL 0.5.8 or higher
    - GNOME 2.16 or higher
